attributes.action: Residency and age qualifications for parliamentary candidates
attributes.additional_details:
In order to make MPs more representative of their constituents and to increase the experience of real life that an MP brings to the Commons two measures should be introduced:
1. Any candidate for a parliamentary election must have a minimum residency in the constituency equal to or greater than the maximum period between elections + 1 month.
2. Any candidate satisfying the above should also have a minimum age of 25 years at the time of the election.
